name: Pousada Hibiscus Beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for three days at Hibiscus Beach right before Christmas. The rooms are located along a hillside and require a little climbing to reach your room. However, the views from the porches are great since you can overlook the town and ocean. The staff is both English and Brazilian and are very friendly and helpful. The food in the breakfast was a delight with the fresh fruits being the highlight. The rooms are small cottages but are completely adequate for the limited time you will stay in them when the beach is calling.
reviews.title: Terrific Place to Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Prior to our visit to Buzios we were made to prepay for this room before we arrived ,on our arrival the accommodations were not as described and by no means met a 3 star level that this hotel boast.
reviews.title: What a nightmare

reviews.text: We refused the room and were told initially that we would not receive a refund of any amount even the erroneous charge of an additional day on the bill and that I should return the next day to discuss this issue with another individual at the hotel.
reviews.title: buzios

reviews.text: When I arrived the next morning I was told that I was being issued a Brazilian check for the amount of the charge and I would have to find someone there that had a bank account in order to cash this check and it wasn’t there problem.

reviews.title: I felt welcomed

reviews.text: This hotel is ranked top-three amongst hotels/pousadas in Buzios, which is a bit worrying... However, we have only stayed in this hotel in Buzios and can only compare it to other pousadas in Brasil within the same price range.
reviews.title: Simple hotel, but ok value

likes.disliked: — The overall finish of the hotel room

reviews.text: We found the hotel rooms to be very basic. The rooms are rather small and s-i-m-p-l-e, however adequate. The cleanliness was not 100 pct and both cockroaches and lizards found their way into our bathroom. On the positive side, most rooms have a full-on seaview and an ice-cold beer tastes fantastic while you are enjoying views of the breathtaking deep-blue water and the lush vegetation surrounding the pousada.
reviews.title: What a lovely place

reviews.text: Our kids really enjoyed the swimming pool, however small it was perfect for them to have a "splash" after breakfast and after returning home from the beach.
reviews.title: Quite nice pousada in great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast was very basic and did not have that "little extra" that you sometimes find in family-run places like this one. The fruit was not always fresh and there were only 1-2 choices of bread available. What's worse, the orange juice was watered out, which during my three years in Brasil I have not experienced before nor after our stay at "Hibiscus".
reviews.title: A magical place !

likes.disliked: — Er, can't think of anything to put here!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel staff in general seemed to be quite tired during our stay. However, when we asked with help on booking beach buggies they assisted us. Also, they helped us find a doctor that could receive my daughter who came down with an ear infection.
reviews.title: a simply wonderful experience

reviews.title: A good choice for Buzios

reviews.text: The pousada is nice (simple) and the bungallow are well decorated and confortable. All of them have a terrace looking over the beach.
reviews.title: Impressed by upgrade of Bungalows

reviews.text: Breakfast is simple but filling, perhaps you miss a bit of variety after two days.
reviews.title: Wondeful stay, best vacation ever
Great - if you like the outdoor experience
reviews.text: Service is good and the reception people very helpful with tips and directions.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For the price, is a very good choice in Buzios
reviews.title: Strongly Recommended

likes.liked: — The private little houses, and sea view.

reviews.text: The pousada has several individual chalets, right on top of each other, so there is little privacy, especially if you are out on your balcony. We were on the back edge of the property which had a very loud barking dog most nights. The inside of the chalet was clean, but smelled very musty. For three people it was very tight. The sheets and towels were horrible (hence the feeling at camp comment). They did provide beach towels. The breakfast was very good, but served a little late (8:30). Its a short walk to the beach (2 blocks). Some pousadas are much further up the hill, so the location was good in that sense. About a 10-15 minute walk to the main drag (Rua Pedras) where most of the restaurants are (dont eat anywhere near the hotel). The staff was nice and helpful. I think for the money or a little more, you can stay in a much better place, especially off season. Buzios is a very beautiful place. The vendors on the beach get a little old.
reviews.title: OK stay at tropical camp

reviews.text: We had originally booked for two nights, but loved the hotel and Búzios so much that we extended our stay. Guest have a cozy cottage all to themselves, and our room was very comfortable, beautifully clean and had everything we needed. The highest rooms have the best sea views, and we were lucky to be given number 9, right at the top.
reviews.title: Loved This Hotel

likes.liked: — Cozy, comfortable, individual cottages. Stunning sea views. Close to beach. Friendly service. Great breakfast.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff are really friendly and most speak English. The service is great and we would like to recommend this hotel. By the way, we met a Norwegian girl at the hotel who had already been staying there for more than two weeks, and was planning to stay on for at least seven more days !
reviews.title: Perfect location and extremely competent staff

reviews.text: Búzios in June is quiet, with plenty of room on the beaches and in the restaurants and bars. During our stay, the península was bathed in sunlight, with spectacular sunsets which gave the place an enchanted feeling. Can’t wait to go back, and we will definitely return to Hibiscus Beach.
reviews.title: A stay at Pousada Hibiscus Beach. Adelightful experience.

likes.liked: — The simple elegance of the setting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My girlfriend and I stayed at Hibiscus Beach for 4 nights in May 2008. The pousada is located near Joao Fernandez beach (a 3 minute walk from the Pousada) and near Ossos (a further 6 - 7 minute walk). Hibiscus Beach is run by an English/Irish couple who have been in Buzios for over 20 years. The pousada was pretty much exactly what we were after. Our room was in a stand-alone small chalet with a small terrace/balcony with nice views down the hillside (and you can see the sea in the distance). Comfortable and well-presented. Nothing fancy, but I could have stayed there for longer with no complaints. Plenty of room for two. Everything you need including a safe (for £1 a day extra). All the chalets are on a grassy hillside behind Joao Fernandez beach (very quiet and serene but you don’t feel like you are lost in the middle of nowhere), but the walk up to the bungalows isn’t taxing – we stayed in number 3 and you have to walk up maybe 30 steps to get there. It’s no worse than walking up a flight of stairs to be honest. There is a pool too though we didn’t try it as we went for the beaches. Breakfast is relatively simple and the same kind we tended to find most places we were in Brazil – fresh juice, breads and condiments, yoghurt, cuts of meat and cheese, scrambled eggs etc. Enough to get you going. The breakfast is set up in the main part of the pousada where the reception is located, and is pleasant as you sit semi-outdoors on a kind of veranda/terrace overlooking the pool. We thought the best things about this place were a). the staff who all spoke English and were extremely helpful in organizing transfers, buggies, take-aways etc etc both before and during our stay and b). the location. Joao Fernandez is a beautiful beach just moments away from the pousada. There’s a decent amount going on there (even in autumn when we were there). A few beach side bars selling grilled fish, drinks etc etc. It is also just a 10 minute walk from Ossos which has restaurant options for both lunch and dinner (not many, but the ones there are nice enough, and there’s a great beach – Azeda, my favourite in Buzios - just round the corner from Ossos). Ossos is on the beachfront and there is a lovely little marina just in front. From there, a walk along the sea front takes you into town. We loved the walk! It’s along some wooden decking, past the statue of Brigitte Bardot etc and into all the bars and restaurants of town which is VERY pretty. Try Brigitte’s for dinner if you want a nice fish dinner, but make sure you go through the restaurant for a table at the back overlooking the beach. And try Chez Michou for crepes! All in all, if you want a stress free, pleasant stay in a good location at reasonable cost, you can’t do much better. You won’t have anything to worry about and we came away feeling we’d picked a really good spot. It’s not absolute luxury, but then again very little in Brazil is and Hibiscus Beach is as good as we found anywhere. Incidentally, taxis to get around buzios are £3 each way (it seems to be a flat rate) but we recommend you rent a buggy. We got them cheap for around £20 per day (organized by the pousada, they’re a bit more in peak season) and they are absolutely fantastic for driving round the peninsula and checking out all the beaches. Have a great trip.
reviews.title: So Glad We Chose The Hotel Pousada Hibiscus

likes.liked: — FLUENT IN ENGLISH, ITS VIES, ITS CLEANLINESS

description: This delightful small hotel is British owned and managed. Remodeled and upgraded in 2007. The hotel consists of individual bungalows, all having a balcony with spectacular sea view. 100 mts. from the peninsula's most attractive beach. Air-conditioned and fully equipped. Large tropical garden and pool. Transfers available from Rio Airport or hotels. Ideal for English speaking guests, but with an authentic Brazilian atmosphere. Elegance and comfort at a reasonable cost.
